docs.snippet: How Khizr and Ghazala Khan, parents of a soldier killed in Iraq, came to challenge Donald J. Trump and reshape a presidential campaign....
docs.lead_paragraph: How Khizr and Ghazala Khan, parents of a soldier killed in Iraq, came to challenge Donald J. Trump and reshape a presidential campaign.
docs.abstract: Profiles of Khizr and Ghazala Khan, parents of late American soldier Humayun Khan who criticized Donald J Trump's position on Muslims during Democratic National Convention, effectively reshaping presidential campaign; Kahns have become public figures overnight, wreaking havoc on their simple way of life as Americans.

headline.main: Moment in Convention Glare Shakes Up Khans’ American Life
headline.print_headline: Moment in Convention Glare  Stirs Parents’ American Life

byline.contributor: Salman Masood and Jackson Landers contributed reporting. Susan Beachy and Jack Begg contributed research.
byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD, RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and MELISSA EDDY

docs.snippet: The new data undercuts Republican arguments that the recovery is faltering and suggests that workers are seeing benefits from the drop in unemployment....
docs.lead_paragraph: The new data undercuts Republican arguments that the recovery is faltering and suggests that workers are seeing benefits from the drop in unemployment.
docs.abstract: Labor Dept reports increase in hiring and salaries, signal that economy is strengthening, not ebbing as Republicans have suggested; upswing in jobs coincides with sharp drop in unemployment among least-educated workers, group that has missed out on nearly all gains of current recovery thus far.

headline.main: Strong Job Gains, for Second Month, Reframe Economic Outlook
headline.print_headline: Big Job Gains for Second Month Shape Debate Over the Economy

docs.snippet: Republican Donald Trump acted to steer his White House campaign back into favor with his party's establishment on Friday by endorsing U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan and two Republican senators seeking re-election, after expressing...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Donald Trump acted to steer his White House campaign back into favor with his party's establishment on Friday by endorsing U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan and two Republican senators seeking re-election, after expressing coolness toward them earlier this week.

headline.main: Trump Endorses Ryan, Senators in Effort to Right Campaign Ship
headline.print_headline: Trump Endorses Ryan, Senators in Effort to Right Campaign Ship

docs.snippet: She has lived since childhood in a world of politics and power, but relatives and friends describe her as being uncommonly unimpressed by the trappings of privilege....
docs.lead_paragraph: She has lived since childhood in a world of politics and power, but relatives and friends describe her as being uncommonly unimpressed by the trappings of privilege.
docs.abstract: Profile of Anne Holton, wife of Democratic vice-presidential candidate Tim Kaine; Holton is described by friends and family as person who is uncommonly unimpressed by trappings of power and privilege, despite her upbringing in household of former governor.

headline.main: For Anne Holton, Tim Kaine’s Wife, Elite Circles Are Old Turf
headline.print_headline: For a Candidate’s Wife, Elite Circles Are Old Turf

docs.snippet: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti acknowledged Saturday that the results of November's U.S. presidential election could weigh heavily on his city's chances of hosting the 2024 Olympics, saying that a victory by Donald Trump could turn off IOC voters...
docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti acknowledged Saturday that the results of November's U.S. presidential election could weigh heavily on his city's chances of hosting the 2024 Olympics, saying that a victory by Donald Trump could turn off IOC voters.

headline.main: LA Mayor: Trump Victory Could Turn Off IOC Voters to '24 Bid
headline.print_headline: LA Mayor: Trump Victory Could Turn Off IOC Voters to '24 Bid

docs.snippet: Economic growth in advanced nations has been weaker for longer than it has been in most people’s lifetimes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Economic growth in advanced nations has been weaker for longer than it has been in most people’s lifetimes.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; United States, along with other advanced nations around world, is experiencing protracted period of slow economic growth, adding to widespread anxieties; slowdown, which has extended over 15 years and has failed to respond to common remedies, will present problem to victor in November's presidential election.

headline.main: We’re in a Low-Growth World. How Did We Get Here?
headline.print_headline: A Low-Growth World: One Key to Persistent Economic Anxiety

docs.snippet: Endangered Sen. Pat Toomey is banking on Pennsylvania voters backing him in November even if they oppose fellow Republican Donald Trump, a ticket-splitting strategy that may help determine whether the GOP can hang on to its Senate majority this el...
docs.lead_paragraph: Endangered Sen. Pat Toomey is banking on Pennsylvania voters backing him in November even if they oppose fellow Republican Donald Trump, a ticket-splitting strategy that may help determine whether the GOP can hang on to its Senate majority this election year.

headline.main: GOP Sen. Toomey Banking on Split-Ticket Voting in Pa. Race
headline.print_headline: GOP Sen. Toomey Banking on Split-Ticket Voting in Pa. Race

headline.main: Insult Dog Triumph, Fake Roger Ailes Star in Hulu Special
headline.print_headline: Insult Dog Triumph, Fake Roger Ailes Star in Hulu Special

docs.snippet: When Americans gloated about winning the Cold War, they opened a door for Russians’ resentment — and Putin’s tactics....
